text: his hands and feet still bore the bloody marks of the cords which bound him day and night .
while the boat was advancing with all the speed its four rowers could give it , felton untied the cord and then the handkerchief which bound milady â€™s hands together .

and as he bound her while saying these words , milady uttered two or three savage cries , which produced a strange and melancholy effect in flying away into the night , and losing themselves in the depths of the woods .
